title: Kimberly-Clark Professional Announces Greenovation Awards for Sustainability Leadership and Waste Reduction - PR Newswire
summary: Kimberly-Clark Professional™ awarded 49 companies with the 2023 Greenovation Awards for sustainability leadership in PPE waste diversion programs.
green_innovation: FALSE: The article discusses waste diversion programs, which may be considered sustainable practices but does not directly introduce new methods or technologies that significantly reduce negative environmental externalities.
business_innovation: TRUE: The introduction of waste diversion programs and recycling initiatives within the PPE industry aligns with the concept of business innovation by implementing new processes that differ significantly from previous practices.
green_product: TRUE: The RightCycle™ Program by Kimberly-Clark Professional™ promotes the recycling of PPE to reduce waste, favoring environmentally responsible practices throughout the product life cycle.
green_process: TRUE: The waste diversion and recycling processes highlighted in the article aim to minimize environmental impacts, reduce waste, and promote sustainability by recycling PPE and transforming them into plastic pellets for manufacturing.
likely_naics_codes: Likely NAICS Codes: 339113 - Surgical Appliance and Supplies Manufacturing, 562920 - Materials Recovery Facilities, 562998 - All Other Miscellaneous Waste Management Services, 621511 - Medical Laboratories
greenwashing: FALSE: The article does not contain any indications of false or misleading claims regarding the environmental benefits of the described waste diversion program.

title: Is ESG more a backspace, than the next page? - Observer Research Foundation
summary: The article discusses the emergence of ESG principles in shaping business practices and their impacts, highlighting the potential value of ESG considerations in driving innovation and competitive advantage albeit with challenges and limitations.
green_innovation: FALSE. The article discusses ESG principles and their impact on business practices, focusing on governance, social responsibility, and sustainability without explicitly detailing specific product or process innovations related to environmental sustainability.
business_innovation: TRUE. The article explores how ESG principles can drive innovation by encouraging companies to invest in research and development of sustainable technologies and practices to address environmental and social challenges, leading to new products, services, and business models.
green_product: FALSE. While the article mentions companies integrating sustainability into their products and services, it does not provide specific details about the design, manufacturing, or usage of products to significantly reduce environmental impact throughout their lifecycle.
green_process: FALSE. While the article touches on sustainability practices and initiatives within companies, it does not delve into specific methods or techniques in manufacturing or operational activities aimed at minimizing environmental impacts and promoting sustainability.
likely_naics_codes: Likely NAICS Codes: 541611 - Administrative Management and General Management Consulting Services, 523930 - Investment Advice, 541690 - Other Scientific and Technical Consulting Services, 523920 - Portfolio Management
greenwashing: FALSE. The article discusses the challenges and limitations of ESG practices, including issues such as inconsistent reporting, greenwashing, and the necessity for meaningful action rather than just surface-level initiatives.

title: A decadal outlook for global aquaculture - World Aquaculture Society - was.org
summary: The article discusses the Global Conference on Aquaculture Millennium +20 (GCA +20) held in Shanghai, emphasizing the role of aquaculture in sustainable development and food security. It outlines production trends in aquaculture, the role of aquaculture in achieving the Sustainable Development Goals, and key outcomes from the GCA +20, including the Shanghai Declaration on Aquaculture for Food and Sustainable Development.
likely_naics_codes: Likely NAICS Codes: 112511 (Finfish Farming and Fish Hatcheries), 112519 (Other Aquaculture), 541711 (Research and Development in Biotechnology), 541620 (Environmental Consulting Services)
